author: Staff Reporter
text:
Members of the Democratic Youth Federation of India (DYFI) staged a demonstration in front of the Collectorate here on Thursday, demanding the government to fill all vacancies in various departments and eliminate corruption in appointment of teachers and other employees.

The demonstration was held as part of DYFI’s State-wide agitation. The federation demanded the government to establish heavy engineering, rubber, coir, perfume and titanium industries in Kanyakumari district.

The protestors demanded the Centre to start preliminary works for the construction of Colachel port and appointment of teachers for minority languages in government schools. The demonstration was presided over by DYFI district president Ebilaisious Joyal and inaugurated by district secretary Regiskumar. Leaders of the Communist Party of India (Marxist) also participated.
title: Fill vacancies: DYFI
